General Info.Title Brief: Record of Title Identifier 1103191 describes the property as being seised of an Estate in Fee Simple in all that land comprising 191 sm more or less being Lot 509 Deposited Plan 578383.
General Info.Location Description: The property at 2/29 Salisbury Road, Birkdale, Auckland is situated in a well-established residential suburb on Auckland's North Shore. The surrounding area primarily features a mix of owner-occupied dwellings on generally suburban sections. Local amenities, including various shops, parks, and community facilities, are readily accessible. Several schools, such as Birkdale Primary and Birkdale Intermediate, serve the area, with further educational options available in nearby suburbs. Public transportation, predominantly bus services, provides connections to Auckland's wider network and to ferry terminals offering links to the CBD. Under normal conditions, Auckland CBD is approximately a 20-30 minute drive away.

commentarySelections.c3-previous-sale: There are no sales listed for the property within the last three years.
commentarySelections.c4-contract-sale: have viewed S&P – no unusual or onerous clauses. We have been provided with a copy of the Agreement for Sale and Purchase of Real Estate dated 14 July 2025, which recorded the property sold at $890,000 including GST.
commentarySelections.c5-supplied-docs:
In undertaking this valuation we have been supplied with copies of the following documents:
•	A copy of the Agreement for Sale and Purchase of Real Estate dated on 14 July 2025.
commentarySelections.c7-lim: We have not been provided with or obtained a copy of the Land Information Report (LIM) for the subject property.  We have assumed there are no outstanding issues or requisitions
commentarySelections.c8-pc78:
Under the proposed zone – Plan Change 78, the property has a zoning of Residential – Terrace Housing and Apartment Buildings.  This zone is a high intensity zone enabling a greater intensity of development providing for urban residential living in the form of terrace housing and apartments.  This zone is predominantly located around metropolitan, town and local centres and the public transport network to support the highest levels of intensification.  
Due to the intensification that can be achieved within this zone, dwellings are a restricted discretionary activity with building coverage not exceeding 50% of the net site area.  The following standards must be complied with when constructing dwellings within this zone:
Building Height 
Height in relation to boundary 
Minimum yard depth setbacks from each boundary
Maximum impervious area
Fencing and wall restrictions
Vacant proposed site subdivision is a restricted discretionary activity within this zone and allows a net site area of 1,200 sm for parent sites that are less than one hectare. 
The Terrace Housing and Apartment Buildings zone aims to keep land near public transport networks efficient with their use and to be of a high-density.  Development focuses on high, predominantly five, six or seven storey buildings in identified areas, in a variety of forms.  Non-residential activities provide for the community’s social, economic and cultural well-being so as to contribute to the amenity of the neighbourhood.
commentarySelections.c9-operative-zone:
Under the Auckland Unitary Plan (Operative in Part), the property has a zoning of Residential – Mixed Housing Suburban.  This zone is to be the most widespread residential zone in Auckland.  Its density controls allow a moderate level of intensification, while retaining a relatively spacious quality consistent with a suburban residential character, compared to the Mixed Housing Urban and Terrace Housing and Apartment Buildings zones.  
Subdivision and development within the zone allows two dwellings per site as a permitted activity and three or more dwellings being a restricted discretionary activity.  Further, development of two dwellings will need to comply with the following standards within the Mixed Housing Suburban zone:
Building Height
Height in relation to boundary
Minimum yard depth setbacks from each boundary
Maximum impervious area
Building coverage
Landscaped area
Outlook space
Daylight ingress
Outdoor living space
Fencing and wall restrictions
Subdivision for three or more dwellings within this zone, while being restricted discretionary will also need to comply with the following standards within the zone, building height; height in relation to boundary and minimum yard depth setbacks from each boundary. 
Vacant proposed site subdivision is a restricted discretionary activity within this zone and allows a net site area of 400 sm for parent sites that are less than one hectare.  For parent sites that are in excess of one hectare, vacant proposed site subdivision is a discretionary activity with the following rules regarding site areas:
Minimum net site area	320 sm
Minimum average net site area	400 sm
Maximum average net site area	480 sm
The Mixed Housing Suburban zone aims to enable a variety of housing types and encourage development as it is the most wide-spread residential zone under the unitary plan.  The zone is concentrated around residential use but allows for non – residential activities that will support the social and economic well-being of the community while monitoring any effects on the residential amenity of the zone.
commentarySelections.c12-condition: a. The property is presented to a new standard and good condition, both externally and internally.
commentarySelections.c13-site-desc-1:
"Cross Lease:  As shown above, the subject property, Flat 2, is positioned at the rear of a cross-lease site with a total area of approximately 1,214 sm. Access to the property is via a shared driveway, marked as “Common Area,” measuring some 35 metres from the street frontage. The subject property occupies the exclusive land use area “C,” with an estimated site area of approximately 530 sm. The site has an eastern boundary / width of approximately 16.4 metres and an average depth of around 32 metres, with the dwelling positioned towards the front of the site.
Contourwise, the site falls steeply towards the rear."
commentarySelections.c14-site-desc-2: In terms of catchments and hydrology, overland flow paths traverse the north-eastern corner of the lot; however, the dwelling itself does not appear to be directly affected.
commentarySelections.c15-sales-evidence:
"FREEHOLD TOWNHOUSE: In assessing the market value of the subject property, we have considered dwellings that sold and under contract within the subject development together with recently completed townhouse developments in the surrounding area, with emphasis on properties of comparable location, age, building size, and land area.
The comparable townhouses analysed range in size from 136 sm - 164 sm, with an average of approximately 146 sm, which is broadly in line with the subject. Site sizes range from 165 sm - 216 sm, with an average of around 177 sm. The analysed land and building rates vary from approximately $8,540 psm - $9,560 psm, with an average of about $8,890 psm. Generally, the lower end of this range reflects larger townhouse units, while the higher end relates to smaller dwellings.
Of particular note, within the subject development the remaining three lots are either sold or currently under contract. Lot A and Lot C, which have identical configurations, floor areas, and similar land sizes, both occupy road-front positions. These have transacted or are under contract between May 2025 and the present at prices ranging from $1,255,000 - $1,300,000, reflecting analysed land and building rates of $8,840 psm - $9,570 psm.
On balance, and taking into account the physical attributes of the property including its age, size, condition, views, and aspect, together with also allowing for the prevailing market conditions, we believe the subject property would warrant a market value ranging between $1,250,000 – $1,290,000, and we deem it appropriate in this instance to adopt the mid-point of this range at a figure of $1,270,000, which reflects a land and building rate of approximately $8,950 psm, comfortably within the evidence range outlined above."
commentarySelections.2d161ebb-6a0d-4613-ba19-26b27bc4cabc: searched a copy of Title Identifier, reviewed the supplied documentation
commentarySelections.d05e7455-7c49-4f6c-a104-98e6a99ef052: We set down the floor plans below, sourced from the advertising website.
commentarySelections.7d4c3595-f966-4e4e-9c4d-7f657ee78d3e: The construction sector remains under pressure, with building costs remaining high due to inflation and labour shortages. Newly constructed dwellings continue to see reasonable sale volume levels, but did take a hit in terms of price levels, with declines experienced in the past two or three years. These are somewhat more stable now, but risk remains at a moderate level.

constructionBrief.finalBrief:
General construction elements comprise what appears to be timber flooring, timber weatherboard cladding, horizontal timber cladding, vertical timber cladding, brick cladding, plaster cladding and fibre cement sheet cladding.
The interior appears to be mostly timber framed with hard board and plasterboard or of similar linings.
